key_points: Security Council demands Taliban ensure safe passage out of Afghanistan and prevent the country from being a terrorism shelter.
Resolution, mainly pushed by the USA, UK, and France, strongly condemns the deadly attack at Kabul airport by ISKP.
More than 150 people were killed and over 200 injured in the Kabul airport blasts.
The US has evacuated over 122,000 people from Afghanistan since July.
The resolution emphasizes the importance of safe passage for Afghans and foreign nationals at any time.
It calls for all parties to facilitate humanitarian assistance with safe and unhindered access.
France and the UK stress the importance of protecting human rights and the gains made over the past two decades.
Russia abstained from voting, citing the resolution's failure to address concerns about combating international terrorism.
China emphasizes the chaos in Afghanistan is tied to the disorderly withdrawal of foreign troops and calls for reflection.
The resolution seeks to hold the Taliban accountable to their commitments as judged by their actions.
spokespersons: Nathalie Estival-Broadhurst (Deputy Permanent Representative of France)
